ascension-public.description: L'île de l'Ascension est située au milieu de l'océan Atlantique. En 2019, la totalité des 445 000 kilomètres carrés (171 800 miles carrés) des eaux de l'Ascension a été désignée comme une aire marine protégée.
ascension-public.name: Île d'Ascension

cmar_core_mpas-public.description: Initiated in 2004, the Eastern Tropical Pacific Marine Conservation Corridor is a regional conservation and sustainable use initiative of the governments of Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador and Panama that seeks the proper management of biodiversity and marine and coastal resources through ecosystem management and the establishment of joint regional government strategies. All supported by civil society, international cooperation and non-governmental organizations, anchored in ten core MPAs in the Pacific ocean EEZs of the four countries.
cmar_core_mpas-public.name: CMAR core MPAs

colombia_3-public.description: Colombia has created and managed MPAs along its Pacific and Caribbean coasts spanning Yurupari-Malpelo Integrated Management District, where the fully protected Malpelo Sanctuary of Fauna and Flora is nested, Lomas and Colinas, Gorgona, and Cabo Manglares in the Pacific Ocean, as well as Beata and Corales de Profundidad in the Caribbean Sea.
colombia_3-public.name: Colombia

costa_rica_1-public.description: Cocos Island National Park is a fully protected area spanning nearly 55,000 square kilometers. Bicentennial Marine Managed Area which surrounds Cocos Island National Park is 106,000 square kilometers.
costa_rica_1-public.name: Costa Rica

fiji-public.description: Située dans le Pacifique Sud, la République des Fidji se compose de 322 îles et possède une zone économique exclusive de plus de 1,2 million de kilomètres carrés (460 000 miles carrés).
fiji-public.name: Fiji

galapagos_and_hermandad-public.description: Galápagos Marine Reserve covers 133,000 square kilometers (51,300 square miles) of Pacific Ocean off the coast of South America. The Galápagos Marine Reserve was expanded with the creation of the Hermandad Marine Reserve to cover an additional 60,000 square kilometers (23,000 square miles).
galapagos_and_hermandad-public.name: Galapagos and Hermandad

galapagos-public.description: Classée au patrimoine mondial de l'UNESCO, la réserve marine des Galápagos couvre 133 000 kilomètres carrés (51 300 miles carrés) de l'océan Pacifique, au large de l'Amérique du Sud.
galapagos-public.name: Galápagos

guyana-public.description: La zone économique exclusive de la Guyane est située au large de la côte nord-est de l'Amérique du Sud et couvre 137 000 kilomètres carrés (52 800 miles carrés) d'océan.
guyana-public.name: Guyane

maldives-public.description: La République des Maldives est un archipel situé dans l'océan Indien et possède le septième plus grand système de récifs au monde. Les Maldives ont une zone économique exclusive qui couvre une superficie de près d'un million de kilomètres carrés (385 000 miles carrés).
maldives-public.name: Maldives

mediterranean-public.description: La Méditerranée et la mer Noire couvrent près de 3 millions de kilomètres carrés (1,1 million de miles carrés) d'océan entre l'Europe et l'Afrique.
mediterranean-public.name: Méditerranée et mer Noire

micronesia-public.description: Composés de 607 îles, les quatre États fédérés de Micronésie (Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei et Kosrae) ont une zone économique exclusive de plus de 2,6 millions de kilomètres carrés (1 million de miles carrés).
micronesia-public.name: États fédérés de Micronésie

niue-public.description: Niue est située dans l'océan Pacifique central et l'aire marine protégée de Moana Mahu couvre 40 % de la zone économique exclusive de Niue, soit 127 000 kilomètres carrés (49 000 miles carrés).
niue-public.name: Niue

palau-public.description: La République de Palau est un groupe d'îles situé dans l'océan Pacifique occidental. En 2020, Palau a entièrement protégé 80 % de sa zone économique exclusive pour former le sanctuaire marin national de Palau, représentant 475 077 kilomètres carrés (183 000 miles carrés), en fermant ces eaux à toutes les formes d'activités extractives, y compris la pêche.
palau-public.name: Palau

panama_1-public.description: Marine protected areas in Panama total just over 98,000 square kilometers (approximately 38,000 square miles), which include Coiba National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that is a coastal marine protected area off the southwest coast, and the Coiba Ridge Managed Resource Area.
panama_1-public.name: Panama

reserva_de_la_biosfera_cmar-public.description: Initiated in 2004, the Eastern Tropical Pacific Marine Corridor is a voluntary regional cooperative effort to protect one of the most productive and biodiverse ecosystems.
reserva_de_la_biosfera_cmar-public.name: CMAR core MPAs

revillagigedo-public.description: Centered on four volcanic islands south of Mexico’s Baja California peninsula, Revillagigedo National Park was created in 2017 and spans 148,000 square kilometers.
revillagigedo-public.name: Revillagigedo

tristan-public.description: Tristan da Cunha est une île isolée de l'océan Atlantique Sud. En 2020, la communauté de Tristan da Cunha a désigné 90 % de sa zone océanique de 690 000 kilomètres carrés (266 400 milles carrés) pour la protection marine.
tristan-public.name: Tristan da Cunha

activity-report.description: Monitor Apparent Fishing Effort and Vessel Presence in near real-time based on global automatic identification system (AIS) and vessel monitoring system (VMS) data from our partner countries.
activity-report.name: Global Vessel Activity

carrier-portal-report.description: Verify transshipments, track vessels and identify frequently-visited ports to gain a better understanding of carrier vessel activities needed to strengthen transparency and accelerate transshipment reform.
carrier-portal-report.name: Carrier Vessel Portal

deep-sea-mining-public.description: The portal continuously maps and monitors vessels engaged in deep-sea mining activities in regions containing International Seabed Authority (ISA) license areas, which span over 1.5 million square kilometers of the international seabed.
deep-sea-mining-public.name: Deep Sea Mining

detections-report.description: Synthetic aperture radar (SAR) can detect at-sea vessels and structures in any weather conditions. The night lights detections (VIIRS) shows vessels at sea that satellites have detected by the light they emit at night.
detections-report.name: Global Dark Vessel Detections

deep-sea-mining-public.description: The portal continuously maps and monitors vessels engaged in deep-sea mining activities in regions containing International Seabed Authority (ISA) license areas, which span over 1.5 million square kilometers of the international seabed.
deep-sea-mining-public.name: Deep Sea Mining

events-report.description: Global activity on vessel events based on automatic identification system (AIS) , including encounters between two vessels, loitering and port visits.
events-report.name: Global Vessel Events
